page.title: 08HOW CHARING HAS CHANGED
page.content: Helen and Janet interviewed Miss Ruglys about the changes that have taken place in Charing. Miss Ruglys used to be the deputy head of Charing School and has lived in Charing all her life. In Miss Ruglys's view Charing has changed for the better. The roads have been tarmaced so they are smooth. Cars have been invented, which is for the better because it means people can get about more easily. But one problem with cars is that they are noisy and clutter up the streets. This is especially so in Charing with its narrow High Street. The Village has got bigger which Miss Ruglys feels is for the worse because Charing used to be a friendly Village but now its hard to get to know everybody.
